definition: hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
to hook/to sew/to crochet/hook/check mark or tick/window catch
erhua variant of 掛鉤|挂钩[gua4 gou1]

sentences.english: Others issued currencies linked to the price of rye.
sentences.chinese: 其他州的货币与黑麦价格挂钩。

sentences.english: Bends and hooks do not contribute to compression anchorages.
sentences.chinese: 弯曲和挂钩无助于压缩锚地。

sentences.english: Our factory practises direct linking of production and sales, thus ensuring supply of goods.
sentences.chinese: 本厂实行产销直接挂钩，保证供应。

sentences.english: He took off his hat and shawl and went to the rack to hang them up .
sentences.chinese: 他脱去帽子和围巾，走到挂钩前，要把它们挂起来。

sentences.english: Usually only bonuses and long-term incentive plans are tied to results.
sentences.chinese: 通常情况下，只有奖金和长期激励才和业绩挂钩。

sentences.english: Self-punishment and the voluntary expression of the self are bound together.
sentences.chinese: 自我惩罚跟自我的自愿表达，密切挂钩。

sentences.english: The medal links are transformed from Chinese traditional double-dragon Puwen semi-circular jade.
sentences.chinese: 奖牌挂钩由中国传统玉双龙蒲纹璜演变而成。

sentences.english: The post-startup and pre-shutdown hooks are blank by default.
sentences.chinese: 启动后和关闭前挂钩在默认情况下是空的。

sentences.english: We instituted a mechanism to increase social aid and social security benefits when consumer prices rise.
sentences.chinese: 建立社会救助和保障标准与物价上涨挂钩的联动机制。

sentences.english: The picture won't stop up long if you use one of those weak hooks.
sentences.chinese: 你用的那个挂钩不结实，画挂不久就会掉下来。

sentences.english: Keep the tree from toppling by tying it to a ceiling hook.
sentences.chinese: 将树顶端固定在房顶的挂钩上，以避免树倾倒。

sentences.english: He's not about to let mankind off the hook with Judgment Day.
sentences.chinese: 他并不打算让人类从审判日的挂钩上下来。

sentences.english: Winch upgrade, load and a set of dual-reflector system link.
sentences.chinese: 有提升绞盘，负载反光镜和一套双挂钩系统。

sentences.english: The designer host is the hook into the design-time environment.
sentences.chinese: 设计器宿主是到设计时环境的挂钩。

sentences.english: A framework is larger grained than just a single class, typically. Also, you hook into frameworks by subclassing somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 通常你通过在某个例子子类化来与框架挂钩。

definition: to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
to fix/to fasten/to set rigidly in place/fixed/set/regular

height/altitude (aviation)/pitch (music)/ups and downs (success or failure)/whether sth is right or wrong/comparative strength, weight, depth, stature/(spoken interjection) anyway, whatever/eventually, in the end
whether or not (at the end of a phrase)
length/duration/accident/right and wrong/good and bad/long and short
equal to/having the same social class or status
